titles.title: Wǝddase ʾamlak “Praise of God” / ʾArganonä wǝddase “The Harp of Praise”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Wǝddase ʾamlak “Praise of God” (fols. 2ra-123rb) I-1) Monday’s prayer of Basil of Caesarea (fols. 2ra-16ra) I-2) Tuesday’s prayer of Efrem the Syrian (fols. 16rb-39vb) I-3) Wednesday’s prayer of Efrem the Syrian (fols. 39vb-57ra) I-4) Thursday’s prayer of John Saba (ʾArägawi Mänfäsawi) (fols. 57rb-78va) I-5) Friday’s prayer of Shenute (78va-88ra) and Pachomius (fols. 88ra-96rb) I-6) Saturday’s prayer of Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 96rb-109rb) I-7) Sunday’s prayer of Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 109rb-123rb) II) ʾArganonä wǝddase “The Harp of Praise” (fols. 124ra-233rb) II-1) Monday (fols. 124ra-143ra) II-2) Tuesday (fols. 144ra-161vb) II-3) Wednesday (fols. 162ra-179va) II-4) Thursday (fols. 180ra-198rb) II-5) Friday (fols. 198rb-214va) II-6) Saturday (fols. 214vb-223va) II-7) Sunday (fols. 223vb-233rb)
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: The original name of the donor has been washed out and replaced with the name of Täklä Haymanot, written with a thin pen in a secondary hand (the same as Additio 1): fols. 2ra, 4va, 5va, 16rb, 39vb, 47va, 49va, 52ra, 57rb, 62rb, 78va, 88ra, 95rb, 96rb, 109rb, 113va, 233rb. Other names are written interlinearly in a different (more recent?) hand, in strong vermilion ink: Gäbrä Giyorgis (fols. 2ra, 3rb, 4va, 5va, 9ra, 9va, 233rb), Täklä ʾƎgziʾ (fols. 13ra, 16rb), Wälättä ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ (fol. 21ra), Wäl(dä) Śǝllase (fol. 26vb), Gäbrä Mikaʾel (fol. 35va), Wäldä Gäbrʾel (fol. 39vb), Wälättä Gäbrǝʾel (fol. 47va), Wälättä Śǝllase (fol. 53vb), ʿAmdä Maryam (fol. 57rb), Wälättä ʾIyäsus (fol. 78va), Zämmädä Maryam (fol. 95rb), Gäbrä Mäsqäl (fol. 109 rb), ʾAqba Mikaʾel (fol. 155ra), Fǝqǝrtä Mikaʾel (fol. 233rb). Text III mentions ʾAsratä Maryam (fol. 234va).

txstates.txstate: The front board is re-used, and attached to the textblock in reversed position. The leather cover of the front board and of the spine is partly missing; of the back board partly detached. The Ms. was resewn; the sewing is damaged. Some 10 initial quires of the textblock are loose and crudely attached with recent threads. Quire I is loosely attached to the textblock, quire IX and XVII are partly detached from the textblock. Tear carefully amended on fol. 76.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (partly missing); textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the remains of the reddish-brown leather cover (7 tools wereused: zig-zag; triple line fillet; double circle; x form; criss-cross; cross hatching, double line fillet with dots).

bnothers.bnother: Four rows of small holes (two close to the head, and two close to the tail) are visible on the spine folds of the quires.

inks.ink: Black; red; deep vermilion; strong vermilion.

squires.squire: A (1sl.) – I(8/fols. 2r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – VIII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – IX(8/fols. 66r-73v) – X(8/fols. 74r-81v) – XI(8/fols. 82r-89v) – XII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – XIII(8/fols. 98r-105v) – XIV(8/fols. 106r-113v) – XV(8/fols. 114r-121v) – XVI(2/fols. 122r-123v) – XVII(8/fols. 124r-131v) – XVIII(8/fols. 132r-139) – XIX(8/fols. 140r-147v) – XX(8/fols. 148r-155v) – XXI(8/fols. 156r-162v) – XXII(8/fols. 163r-170v) – XXIII(8/fols. 171r-178v) – XXIV(8/fols. 179r-186v) – XXV(8/fols. 187r-194v) – XXVI(8/fols. 195r-202v) – XXVII(6/fols. 203r-208v) – XXVIII(8/fols. 209r-216v) – XXIX(8/fols. 217r-224v) – XXX(10/fols. 225r-234v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: very fine and careful, regular.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: Texts I and II;

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; incipits and headings of the texts (a few lines are rubricated, alternating with black lines, on fols. 2ra-rb, 57rb, 78vb, 109rb, 124ra-rb, 144ra-rb, 162ra-rb, 180ra-rb, 198rb, 214vb, 223vb); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numbers; names of the days of the week in Text I and II.

additional.add: Fol. 233rb: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ዘአጥረዮ፡ በንዋዩ፡ ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ፈቃደ፡ አበምኔት፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዝ፡ ለይኩን። ። ።
additional.tran: Fol. 233rb: This is the book of Täklä Haymanot who acquired it with his own money. The one who stole (what is written in) it or the one who scratched it without the permission of the abbot shall be excomunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul.
additional.det: The note is written in the same hand as the one that added the name of the donor Täklä Haymanot.

additional.cont: Fols. 233va-234rb: Excerpt from ˀArganonä wǝddase “The Harp of Praise”.
additional.det: Written in a different, less regular and skilled hand. Cp. the main text fols. 233va-234rb (the list of the saints mentioned is somewhat different from the standard version).

extras.extra: - The title of Text II is crudely written on the back board with yellow paint. - The last two lines on fol. 161vb are written in a different hand. - Some lines of Text I are washed out and replaced with a text written in a different hand (possibly the same hand as the one that wrote the name of the donor Täklä Haymanot) eg. on fols. 9rb, 17vb, 23ra, 49rb, 73ra. - Writing excercises: fol. 1r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Names of the days of the week indicating daily readings are written in the centre of the upper margin, in Text I (fols. 2r, 16r, 39v, 57r, 78v, 96r, 109r) and in Text II (fols. 124r, 144r, 162r, 180r, 198r, 214v, 215r, 223v, 224r), rubricated, between two dot lines.
